body_html:
Seems to be a common issue with CUDA and some versions of GCC.
marian-nmt/marian-dev#151
ComputationalRadiationPhysics/alpaka#426
pytorch/pytorch#3963
Which is weird because I managed to compile Tensorflow from source with CUDA 9.1/CUDnn 7.0 support on 2018-01-05.
I tried compiling without CUDA support and Tensorflow does compile. Next I tried compiling with gcc-5 however this failed with the following error:

/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/5.5.0/include/avx512vlintrin.h(11300): error: argument of type "void *" is incompatible with parameter of type "long long *"

Next I tried to compile with gcc 7.2.1 resulting in the following error:

#error -- unsupported GNU version! gcc versions later than 6 are not supported!
body_text:
Seems to be a common issue with CUDA and some versions of GCC.
marian-nmt/marian-dev#151
ComputationalRadiationPhysics/alpaka#426
pytorch/pytorch#3963
Which is weird because I managed to compile Tensorflow from source with CUDA 9.1/CUDnn 7.0 support on 2018-01-05.
I tried compiling without CUDA support and Tensorflow does compile.  Next I tried compiling with gcc-5 however this failed with the following error:

/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/5.5.0/include/avx512vlintrin.h(11300): error: argument of type "void *" is incompatible with parameter of type "long long *"

Next I tried to compile with gcc 7.2.1 resulting in the following error:

#error -- unsupported GNU version! gcc versions later than 6 are not supported!
body:
Seems to be a common issue with CUDA and some versions of GCC.
https://github.com/marian-nmt/marian-dev/pull/151
https://github.com/ComputationalRadiationPhysics/alpaka/issues/426
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/3963
Which is weird because I managed to compile Tensorflow from source with CUDA 9.1/CUDnn 7.0 support on 2018-01-05.
I tried compiling without CUDA support and Tensorflow does compile.  Next I tried compiling with gcc-5 however this failed with the following error:
> /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/5.5.0/include/avx512vlintrin.h(11300): error: argument of type "void *" is incompatible with parameter of type "long long *"

Next I tried to compile with gcc 7.2.1 resulting in the following error:
> #error -- unsupported GNU version! gcc versions later than 6 are not supported!
